s.text: True, thanks to New York's absurd election laws, it's hard to get on the ballot unless you have the blessing of the party establishment.
It's also true that whoever runs against Hillary would infuriate that same party establishment.
Then, if New York's Republican Mayor Rudolph Giuliani, deprived of the chance to beat Hillary himself, opts out of the race, it would leave you with a clear shot at the U.S.
